messages.subject: RE: Runescape
messages.msgSnippet: My 10yo son plays Runescape. He says he ll add Mystic Jade0 to his friends list.  His online name is gameguy5255.  He is also game guy on Adventure Quest if
messages.messageBody:
My 10yo son plays Runescape. He says he'll add Mystic Jade0 to his friends
list. His online name is gameguy5255. He is also game guy on Adventure
Quest if there are other unschoolers out there who do Battleon.com

-krisula

----original post-----------
Message: 1
Date: Fri, 07 Jan 2005 02:30:52 -0000
From: "crazymuthrof3" <jpellow1@...>
Subject: Runescape


>>We are new to the group, but my 12 year old son plays a lot of Runescape
and we saw that there were others so we wanted to give his user name so he
could get in touch with some other kids who are unschooled. It is Mystic
Jade0. We are new to unschooling and of course I have had a ton of
questions and doubts so it's been good to be able to read about other
peoples experiences.<<

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Runescape
messages.msgSnippet: I ll never keep this current, but here s a collection of some things to help reassure your friends and relatives if you need to (about video games, I mean
messages.messageBody:
I'll never keep this current, but here's a collection of some things to help reassure your friends and relatives if you need to (about video games, I mean <g>):

http://sandradodd.com/games/page

My kids don't do runescape, so I'm no help right there, but at the theoretical level and with reassurance that my games-playing kids are doing well, I'm here.

Sandra

messages.subject: Runescape
messages.msgSnippet: We are new to the group, but my 12 year old son plays a lot of Runescape and we saw that there were others so we wanted to give his user name so he could get
messages.messageBody:
We are new to the group, but my 12 year old son plays a lot of
Runescape and we saw that there were others so we wanted to give his
user name so he could get in touch with some other kids who are
unschooled. It is Mystic Jade0. We are new to unschooling and of
course I have had a ton of questions and doubts so it's been good to
be able to read about other peoples experiences.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Runescape
messages.msgSnippet: I just spoke with my boys and asked if they ve had any problems with people asking personal questions on there. They said A/S/L (age/sex/location) is the only
messages.messageBody:
I just spoke with my boys and asked if they've had any problems with people asking personal questions on there. They said A/S/L (age/sex/location) is the only personal thing they've seen people asking. Well, that and people asking my 16 yo if he is African American or predjudice because his username is Black As You. (A friend signed him up at Merlefest last year and picked that name for him, being silly.) It's actually been neat for him to talk with people on Runescape about this subject, with us living here in the deep south where there is SO much predjudice! His standard answer is "Yes, I'm as black as you and you are as white as me, inside we are all the same color!" I've considered asking him to change his user name, but he is at such a high level it would be a loss of alot of work. Any advice about this would be welcome!

They LOVE Runescape so much we recently started paying the $5 monthly fee to access the whole Runescape world. They suggest new players start out with the free areas until you are very familiar with the game. It kept them busy for a year, and has opened up a whole new fascination with the middle ages.

Anyway, my 13yo's user name is

Bigger Fly

No problems with that name as yet. :-)

Sondra, if you'll give us your daughter's user name we'll say hi!


----- Original Message -----
From: Sondra Carr
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 08, 2004 10:33 PM
Subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Runescape


My daughter also plays - I'd actually love for her to have some friends on
there who are also unschooling. I'm a little worried about her talking to
strangers on it - I played a little and didn't like some personal questions
people were asking. It would be great to have some kids in the game she
could talk with.



Sondra



I'll pass on the info to her.



-----Original Message-----
From: Deirdre Aycock [mailto:aycock@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 2004 10:27 PM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Runescape




> I guess Halo 2 online is out for us, but we also really enjoy Runescape.
Our ds's want to know if anyone wants to start an unschoolers clan on there?
lol
>
> Margie
>

Margie - My son asked me to tell you his Runescape user name is
superman5606. He's 12 y.o. (My daughter's user name is effie5413, but she
isn't playing much these days. ) Please ask your sons to add them to their
friends list and they'll see them online!
Deirdre
